text:
Rerun - Breaking the Black Box
https://media.transistor.fm/1dd56075.mp3 (56:49)
comments: Basecamp co-founder David Heinemeier Hansson sparked a national controversy this week when he posted a series of livid tweets about how his wife received a much lower credit limit than he did on their Apple Cards, despite applying with the same financial information. What began as a rant against opaque algorithms turned into a regulatory investigation and more. In this episode, Dr. Ruha Benjamin of Princeton University and entrepreneur Mara Zepeda, co-founder of the XXcelerate Fund and Zebras Unite, talk about how the tech and financial sectors perpetuate systemic inequalities and how to start repairing the damageâ€”or building something more equitable and inclusive from the ground up.
Tara Reed started a tech company without knowing how to code and now teaches others to do the same.
